meanings.definition: To kill someone for refusing to give up their beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler was martyring the brave rebel who stood firm in his beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The tyrant was martyring the innocent villagers who dared to speak out against him.
meanings.sent3: The evil king enjoyed martyring those who dared to oppose him, thinking he could crush their spirits.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive regime was martyring the voices of dissent, hoping to silence any opposition.
meanings.sent5: The ruthless dictator was martyring all who dared to challenge his authority, creating fear and obedience.

meanings.definition: To inflict great pain or suffering on someone.
meanings.sent1: The bully was martyring the smaller kids on the playground, causing them immense pain.
meanings.sent2: The wicked witch was martyring the captured princess, making her endure unbearable suffering.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was martyring the poor mouse, playing with it before finally catching it.
meanings.sent4: The relentless storm was martyring the old tree, bending its branches and tearing its leaves.
meanings.sent5: The illness was martyring the patient, making every movement a source of agony and torment.

meanings.sent1: The heroic sacrifice martyred the brave soldier, turning him into a symbol of courage.
meanings.sent2: The tragic event martyred the young activist, immortalizing her fight for justice.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected turn of events martyred the ordinary citizen, elevating him to a legendary status.
meanings.sent4: The selfless act of kindness martyred the generous philanthropist, forever remembered for her generosity.
meanings.sent5: The noble sacrifice martyred the humble teacher, inspiring generations with her dedication to education.
